body:
Took a while for me to find the html formatted document, can you edit your top post please adding this link? 

https://go.googlesource.com/proposal/+/1487446b91599daa695905dc51a77d1bcc7086d8/design/16339-alias-decls.md

That said I am just going to concentrate on the first example

```
package L
import "L1"
const X = L1.X  // X is effectively an alias for L1.X
```

Note that I am a beginner and I am doing my very best to understand it completely. But I would go even as far as saying I would not even allow that L1 work around to compile anymore in Go 2.

I would trow a error `const X reference to other package name not allowed.`

For me this is just avoiding branching tools at the cost of code readability, and one should `git checkout` there L1 branch instead? Please make a simple repository in github that clearly shows that two `branches` L1 and L (or submodules) does not solve the problem thank you.
